Legal_Issue: Unreasonable delay in processing citizenship application
Application_Facts: Conille met citizenship requirements except for residence due to prior probation order; CSIS delayed investigation without clear justification
Remedy_Requested: Mandamus to compel processing of citizenship application
Court_Ruling: Registrar must process application unless CSIS provides serious reasons for delay
Defendant_Behavior: CSIS caused unreasonable delay implying refusal
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable delay, lack of adequate remedy
Legal_Standard: Mandamus requires public legal duty, clear right, no alternative remedy, and unreasonable delay
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review seeking writ of mandamus
Evidence_Used: Documentation of application timeline, CSIS investigation status
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act provisions on processing duties
Application_Basis: Fulfillment of statutory requirements except residence
Evidence_Assessed: Length of CSIS delay, absence of security concerns
Relief_Sought: Order compelling processing of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Writ of mandamus available if duty exists and delay is unreasonable
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of justification from CSIS for prolonged delay
Outcome: Application allowed; Minister directed to proceed
Harm_Assessment: Prolonged denial of citizenship rights due to delay
Cause_Description: Unreasonable delay by CSIS in completing security checks
Evidence_Handling: Court inferred refusal due to inaction
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied failure to fulfill statutory processing obligations
Evidence_Issues: Inference of refusal based on silence/delay
Residency_Compliance: Partial non-compliance due to probation order
Decision_Rationale: Delay exceeded reasonable timeframe; CSIS overstepped advisory role
Legal_Standard_Applied: Test for mandamus: duty, right, remedy, unreasonableness

Legal_Issue: Justification for writ of mandamus due to unreasonable delay and usurpation of power
Evidence_Assessment: Three-year CSIS investigation with no conclusive findings
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show unreasonable delay and lack of remedy
Legal_Rule: Mandamus issues when there is a public duty, clear right, and no other remedy
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness of delay and procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Request for court intervention in administrative process
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable delay, CSIS exceeding advisory role
Review_Standard: Whether delay was justified and powers properly exercised
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: CSIS acted as decision-maker despite advisory role
Key_Evidence_Considered: Duration of investigation, lack of communication from CSIS
Legal_Framework: Statutory interpretation of Citizenship Act and mandamus criteria
Applicant_Challenge: Delay and unauthorized exercise of authority by CSIS
Court_Result: Ordered Minister to process application unless justified otherwise
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law writ of mandamus, Citizenship Act
Defendant_Response: No explicit response provided; inaction treated as refusal
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review leading to court order
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act provisions on eligibility and processing
Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Governing_Rule: Mandamus requires duty, right, remedy, and unreasonable delay
